comment:
* Filter event sent from {@link Filter} objects with media type.
 *
 * @hide

methods.name: public boolean isPtsPresent()
methods.comment:
* Returns whether PTS (Presentation Time Stamp) is present.
     *
     * @return {@code true} if PTS is present in PES header; {@code false} otherwise.

methods.name: public long getPts()
methods.comment: * Gets PTS (Presentation Time Stamp) for audio or video frame.

methods.name: public long getDataLength()
methods.comment: * Gets data size in bytes of audio or video frame.

methods.name: public long getOffset()
methods.comment: * The offset in the memory block which is shared among multiple Media Events.

methods.name: public LinearBlock getLinearBlock()
methods.comment: * Gets a linear block associated to the memory where audio or video data stays.

methods.name: public boolean isSecureMemory()
methods.comment:
* Returns whether the data is secure.
     *
     * @return {@code true} if the data is in secure area, and isn't mappable;
     *         {@code false} otherwise.

methods.name: public long getAvDataId()
methods.comment:
* Gets the ID which is used by HAL to provide additional information for AV data. * *

For secure audio, it's the audio handle used by Audio Track.

methods.name: public long getAudioHandle()
methods.comment:
* Gets the audio handle. * *

Client gets audio handle from {@link MediaEvent}, and queues it to * {@link android.media.AudioTrack} in * {@link android.media.AudioTrack#ENCAPSULATION_MODE_HANDLE} format. * * @return the audio handle. * @see android.media.AudioTrack#ENCAPSULATION_MODE_HANDLE

methods.name: public int getMpuSequenceNumber()
methods.comment: * Gets MPU sequence number of filtered data.

methods.name: public boolean isPrivateData()
methods.comment:
* Returns whether the data is private.
     *
     * @return {@code true} if the data is in private; {@code false} otherwise.
